channel.title: Hidden Admin/Owner Rank
channel.description: I have been looking around google and such for a tutorial to do this for a 317 revision project insanity base source, but i couldnt find a tutorial, so if someone could be nice enough and give me a tutorial of how to add this rank for a 317 revision [PI] base that would be excellent :)

item.title: Hidden Admin/Owner Rank
item.dc:creator: @beale beale
item.description:
@beale wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:2, topic:550032”]Technically, the rank already exists.

There is no pre-defined “Ranks” in the server. Whatsoever. The modicons and all that, are done in the client.

So basically, if you want to make a new rank. Just give the player whatever rights you want them to have (as long as it’s a valid Integer). So like 4, 5, 1000, 21846, -1384, whatever.

Then you can assign commands and etc to it, by editing their respected files.

Example, you have the ::players command only for moderators (rights 1) and you want the “hidden admin” (rights 1111) to have access to it:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players") && c.playerRights == 1) { c.sendMessage("there are " + PlayerHandler.players.length + " players online"); }
Now you’d change that to:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players") && (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 1111)) { c.sendMessage("there are " + PlayerHandler.players.length + " players online"); }

Understand that this is not the “best” way to handle your commands, and you should look into a better system if this is similar to what you’re using.
And also note that this was purely an example.[/quote]

Thanks a bunch this definitely helps. rep++

Read full topic

item.title: Hidden Admin/Owner Rank
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Technically, the rank already exists.

There is no pre-defined “Ranks” in the server. Whatsoever. The modicons and all that, are done in the client.

So basically, if you want to make a new rank. Just give the player whatever rights you want them to have (as long as it’s a valid Integer). So like 4, 5, 1000, 21846, -1384, whatever.

Then you can assign commands and etc to it, by editing their respected files.

Example, you have the ::players command only for moderators (rights 1) and you want the “hidden admin” (rights 1111) to have access to it:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players") && c.playerRights == 1) { c.sendMessage("there are " + PlayerHandler.players.length + " players online"); }
Now you’d change that to:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("players") && (c.playerRights == 1 || c.playerRights == 1111)) { c.sendMessage("there are " + PlayerHandler.players.length + " players online"); }

Understand that this is not the “best” way to handle your commands, and you should look into a better system if this is similar to what you’re using.
And also note that this was purely an example.

Read full topic
